document_data.name: Avalor
document_data.mainbody:
'''Avalor''' was the Treespeaker of the [[elves]] of the [[Wealdath]], the great forest found in the realm of [[Tethyr]].

{{Quote|(Is he) the filthy elf who sits at Anais' knee and laps up her scraps?|[[Eveonne Linden#History|Ysabel Linden]], speaking of Avalor.}}
document_data.Personality: Avalor was a powerful yet judicious leader, who instilled trust in those he worked with.
document_data.Abilities: He was quite adept at creating elaborate [[illusion]]s that fooled the senses of others.
document_data.Relationships:
The sagacious elf had one known child, a daughter named [[Liel]],

Avalor served as a member of Queen [[Anais Rhindaun|Anais]]' privy council. This appointment was seen as detestable by those in Tethyr that maintained a distinct and vicious hatred for the elven people.
document_data.History:
While it was not known for sure, some suspected that Avalor was responsible for the [[Children's Massacre]] of Tethyr in the {{YearlinkName|1469}}. One [[Amhar|survivor of the attack]], who managed to remained anonymous saw that the killers had the pointed ears of elves.

In the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, Avalor heard about a supernatural attack in [[Cardewton]], the colony in [[Chult]] in which Liel was staying. Avalor was convinced she was murdered by her husband [[Declan Cardew]]. Avalor hired Harp and his crew to uncover her whereabouts in [[Chult]], or in the worst case scenario, bring back her remains.
